dbmanager

Class JDBCTableModel

  • java.lang.Object
    • javax.swing.table.AbstractTableModel
      • dbmanager.JDBCTableModel
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable, TableModel

    public class JDBCTableModel
extends AbstractTableModel
    A JTable table model. Contains the content of a ResultSet retrieved from a database.
    Author:
    gm310509
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      JDBCTableModel()
      Create an empty JDBCTableModel.
      JDBCTableModel(Connection conn, String query, String mode)
      Creates a JDBCTableModel and retrieves the supplied ResultSet from the database.
      JDBCTableModel(ResultSet resultSet, JDBCTableModelListener listener)
      Creates a JDBCTableModel and retrives the supplied ResultSet from the database.

                      String query,
                      String mode)
               throws SQLException
        Creates a JDBCTableModel and retrieves the supplied ResultSet from the database.
        Parameters:

        Throws:
        SQLException

      • JDBCTableModel

        public JDBCTableModel(ResultSet resultSet,
                      JDBCTableModelListener listener)
               throws SQLException
        Creates a JDBCTableModel and retrives the supplied ResultSet from the database. Row retrieval notifications are sent to the supplied listener.
        Parameters:
        resultSet - the result set to retrieve.
        listener - the listener to notify of rows retrieved.
        Throws:
        SQLException

    • Method Detail

      • initRenderer

        public JDBCTableCellRenderer initRenderer(JTable table,
                                          String nullString)
        Initialise the table cell renderer.

        The table cell renderer draws the individual cells within the JTable.

        Parameters:
        table - the JTable to which the renderer applies
        nullString - a string to be displayed in cells containing a null value.
        Returns:
        the table renderer

      • initRenderer

        public JDBCTableCellRenderer initRenderer(JTable table,
                                          String nullString,
                                          Color nullColour)
        Initialise the table cell renderer.

        The table cell renderer renders the cells in the JTable.

        Parameters:
        table - the table to which the render applies
        nullString - the string to be displayed for null values.
        nullColour - the background colour to display in cells containing the nulls
        Returns:
        the table cell renderer.

      • getValueAt

        public Object getValueAt(int row,
                         int column)
        Retrieves the value at the specified row and column.

        Note that the row and column are JTable row and column numbers, not result set numbers. That is, they start at 0, not 1.

        Parameters:
        row - the row number
        column - the column number.
        Returns:
        the value at that cell.

      • getColumnClass

        public Class getColumnClass(int col)
        Retrieve the class for the specified column.

        Note that the row and column are JTable row and column numbers, not result set numbers. That is, they start at 0, not 1.

        Specified by:
        getColumnClass in interface TableModel
        Overrides:
        getColumnClass in class AbstractTableModel
        Parameters:
        col - the column to retrieve.
        Returns:
        the class.

        public String getColumnName(int col)

        Note that the row and column are JTable row and column numbers, not result set numbers. That is, they start at 0, not 1.

        Specified by:

        Overrides:

      • cleanupLob

        public void cleanupLob()
        Cleanup any LOB files that have been created as a result of the query.

        Note: Failure to call this method when the table is finished with will result in LOB's being left in place when the table model is destroyed.

      • getLobPath

        public String getLobPath()
        Retrieve the LOB path.

        Any large objects retrieved from the database are stored in this location.

        Returns:
        the lob path.

      • setLobPath

        public void setLobPath(String lobPath)
        Sets the lobPath.

        Any large objects retrieved from the database are stored in this location.

        If the directory doesn't exist, it is created. If a problem occurs creating the directoy, the path will be set to null resulting in the system temporary directory being used.

        Parameters:
        lobPath - New value of property lobPath.

      • getSortColumn

        public int getSortColumn()
        Retrieve the current sort column number.

        If the model hasn't been sorted, this method returns -1

        Returns:
        the current sort column number or -1

      • setSortColumn

        public void setSortColumn(int sortColumn)
        Set the sort column number.

        Upon setting this, the data will be resorted.

        Parameters:
        sortColumn -

      • resortData

        public void resortData()
        Sorts the data based upon the column selected.
